contents: Article 27 (Duties of Executives) ① The President represents the Sports Association and supervises its affairs. ② The Vice President assists the President, and when the President is vacant or has difficulty performing his duties due to an accident, the President shall act in the order established when appointing the Vice President. ③ Directors form the Board of Directors, attend the Board of Directors meetings, decide on matters related to their duties, and handle matters delegated by the Board of Directors or the Chairman. ④ The duties of the auditor include the following: The same applies., 1. Auditing the property status of the Athletic Association, 2. Auditing the operation of the Board of Directors and its work, 3. When any illegal or irregularities are discovered regarding the property status or business and budget execution, the Board of Directors or Reporting to the general meeting, 4. Convening the board of directors or general meeting to report under subparagraph 3, 5. Other matters stipulated in accordance with relevant laws and regulations, ⑤ If an executive is accused of a crime related to the operation of the sports association or member organization If indicted, his/her duties will be suspended. However, this does not apply in the following cases: Revised on July 5, 2021, 1. When the only statutory penalty for the indicted crime is a fine, 2. When a summary order is requested, 3. When indicted as a negligent offender, ⑥ When an executive commits a crime other than operating a sports club or member organization If a person is arrested on false grounds, his or her duties will be suspended. Revised July 5, 2021, ⑦ If an executive of a member organization or a person representing a sports organization who has become an officer of the Sports Association is suspended from his or her duties in the relevant organization, his or her duties as an officer of the Sports Association will also be suspended.
